newsitem.title: ESTONIA: LEKS SHAREHOLDERS TO SELL SOME STAKE.
newsitem.headline: LEKS SHAREHOLDERS TO SELL SOME STAKE.

text.p: Large shareholders of Leks Insurance plan to sell some of their stake in the company to meet the requirements for a bourse listing, Leks said on Tuesday.
At least 25 percent of a company's shares must be public before it can get a listing on the Tallinn Stock Exchange.
Leks' largest shareholders are Tallinna Pank with 53 percent and Talinvest with an eight percent stake, the company added in a statement.
Small investors hold 22 percent of the capital.

Leks issued 400,000 shares from April 21 to May 5 to raise its share capital from 38 million kroons to 42 million kroons. Tallinna Pank bought 210,000 shares and 190,000 shares were sold in a public offer.
The price of a 10-kroon par value share was 38 kroons in the issue.
The public offer was oversubscribed 18 times.
Leks Insurance added in the statement that it will invest most of the 15.2 million kroons from the issue into its Latvian subsidiary Saules Laiks.
